text: {p}HEADLINE: Gorgeous weather continues{/p}{p}LOW TODAY: 43{ } { } { } NORMAL LOW: 39{/p}{p}HIGH TODAY: 63{ } { } NORMAL HIGH: 56{/p}{p}Another beauty across southern Nevada as most desert locations climbed above the 60 degree mark for 19th time this December.{/p}{p}Tonight looks great with clear skies and cool temperatures. Look for an overnight low of 43 here in Las Vegas.{/p}{p}Not a whole lot of change for your Friday as high pressure hangs on. If the clouds stay away, we should easily break the 60 degree mark once again tomorrow afternoon, but clouds are expected to increase throughout the afternoon.{/p}{p}A weak area of low pressure will bring a few light showers across southern Nevada late Saturday with the highest chances for free water expected north and west of the valley.{/p}{p}A few hundredths of an inch are possible here in the valley along with 1-2\" of snow in the Spring mountains, mainly above 8,500 feet.{/p}{p}This system will quickly exit on New year's Eve Day with slightly cooler than normal temperatures filtering in just in time for the New Year.{/p}{p}Highs on New Year's Eve and New Year's day should hold in the mid 50s with lows in the lower 40s.{/p}{p}CURRENT SNOWPACK: UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN - 73% (106% last year at this time){/p}{p}LAKE MEAD TRACKER: Lake mead is currently at 1067 feet compared to 1043 feet one year ago today.{/p}{p}Total valley rainfall in 2023: 4.58\" (+0.54\" above normal){/p}{p}Total valley rainfall through December 28th, 2022: 2.13\" (-1.90\" below normal){/p}{p}AIR QUALITY - HEALTHY{/p}{p}POLLEN COUNT:{/p}{p}TREES: NONE{/p}{p}MOLD: LOW{/p}{p}GRASS: NONE{/p}{p}WEEDS: LOW{/p}{p}Bill Bellis{br}{/p}{p}Metro Police said the {strong}{a href=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/las-vegas-police-involved-shooting-blue-diamond-durango-southwest-valley-ois-lvmpd-metro-police-crime-investigation-southern-nevada#\" //news3lv.com/news/local/las-vegas-police-involved-shooting-blue-diamond-durango-southwest-valley-ois-lvmpd-metro-police-crime-investigation-southern-nevada#\"}gunman {/a}{/strong}involved with multiple carjackings and a police shooting rampage, that left him and two people dead in Las Vegas is 36-year-old Justin Davidson, News 3 confirmed.{/p}{p}Davidson has a court record dating back to 2006 with charges involving drugs, traffic violations, possession of a dangerous weapon and two DUI’s News 3 has learned. His most recent charges were a DUI in September and driving with a revoked license in November.{/p}{p}Property records show he co-owns a home in Henderson. Metro Police searched that house on Wednesday as part of their investigation.{/p}{p}Metro Police said officers responded to a wash area by Placid and Maulding Wednesday morning after neighbors reported illegal gunfire.{/p}{p}Surveillance video News 3 obtained show about ten flashes of light from a gun firing in a wash area around 3:35 a.m. according to the time stamp. A truck drives by the wash a minute later and a person gets out of the passenger side, before going towards the wash. The truck turns around and parks on the side of the road.{/p}{p}Metro police said Davidson’s mother and father drove in a truck to the wash to check on their son after hearing gunfire, but he shot at them. Police said he hit and killed his mother, who was a woman in her 50s. Detectives are still working to determine what led to the shooting but said the family residence is nearby and Davidson was there before going to the wash.{/p}{p}{strong}RELATED{ }| {/strong}{a href=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/we-were-supposed-to-grow-old-together-wife-remembers-man-killed-in-carjacking-crime-spree-in-southwest-valley-las-vegas#\" //news3lv.com/news/local/we-were-supposed-to-grow-old-together-wife-remembers-man-killed-in-carjacking-crime-spree-in-southwest-valley-las-vegas#\"}'We were supposed to grow old together': Wife remembers man killed in carjacking crime spree in southwest valley{/a}{/p}{p}On Thursday, police cordoned the wash and a home close to it as part of their investigation.{/p}{p}Officers responded to the wash around 3:40 a.m. on Wednesday, heard gunfire took cover and saw that a patrol vehicle was struck with bullets. Davidson stole the patrol vehicle and led police on a pursuit to the 7300 block of S. Durango Drive, where he stole a citizen's vehicle in a carjacking, said Capt. Joshua Martinez with LVMPD.{/p}{p}The pursuit continued to the 8500 block of Blue Diamond Road, where Davidson carjacked another person, according to Martinez. An officer saw this and opened fire, but Davidson drove away and the pursuit continued to Windmill Lane and Durango.{/p}{p}That's where Nevada State Police located the vehicle, Martinez said. An LVMPD officer arrived and Davidson fired a shot.{/p}{p}\"Officers witnessed the citizen in the vehicle being removed and was injured,\" Martinez said. LVMPD later confirmed that the citizen was pronounced dead at the scene.{/p}{p}Davidson drove away in that person's car and officers opened fire, hitting the car multiple times.{/p}{p}Martinez said the pursuit ended at Durango and Agate Avenue after the car Davidson was driving became disabled and he was dead, as confirmed by LVMPD's SWAT and crisis negotiators who responded and approached the car.{/p}{p}The Clark County Coroner’s office has not officially confirmed the man killed during the hijacking but his wife identified him as Jerry Lopez. She spoke with News 3 on Thursday and said he was on his way to work.
